attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Control orders give the Secretary of State the power to "impose any obligation on the individual against whom it is made." They are made against a person suspected of being connected to terrorism, no proof of this is needed for a control order. In particular restrictions on who the person may communicate with and requirement to allow movement and communication to be monitored and more. "Secretary of State may make a control order imposing an obligation that is incompatible with the controlled person’s RIGHT to LIBERTY under Article 5 of the Human Rights Convention if ... he is satisfied, on the balance of probabilities, that that person is an
individual who is or has been involved in terrorism-related activity."
Control orders fixed periods but may be renewed on one or more occasions. Special advocates are provided to subjects who appeal. The special advocate may look at classified documents that are the grounds for imposing the control order but may NOT talk to the subject after.
